citeinfo.origin: University of Hawaii, Dept. of Oceanography, Sea Level Center, Sea Level
citeinfo.title: Joint Archive for Shipboard ADCP (JASADCP) at the UH

abstract.p: Parameter - Current speed and direction profiles from Shipboard ADCP

Measurement Details:
The JASADCP is responsible for the acquisition, review, documentation, archival, and distribution of shipboard ADCP data sets. The archive primarily handles US national cruises, although it also supports several completed multi-national programs such as TOGA COARE, WEPOCS, and US-PRC cruises. The JASADCP is also a Data Assembly Center for the World Ocean Circulation Experiment (WOCE) in collaboration with the Japan Oceanographic Data Center (JODC). The WOCE archive consists of 15 cruise lines and 55 of the Hawaii Ocean Time-series (HOT) cruises. The growing JASADCP now totals 135 cruises.

Geographic Area:
North and South Pacific Ocean

Custodian:
NODC/University of Hawaii ( Mr. Patrick Caldwell, caldwell@iniki.soest.hawaii.edu)

purpose.p: To aquire, review, document, archive, and distribute shipboard ADCP data sets.

idinfo.accconst: On-line access to data via internet; contact custodian (Mr. Patrick Caldwell, caldwell@iniki.soest.hawaii.edu).
idinfo.useconst: No use constraints after one year after collection other than giving proper citation to the data origin.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
